page.title: 09Tourism in The Shelsleys
page.content: The lack of a public house or hotel is no hindrance to tourism as this is an area of outstanding natural beauty and a conservation area. There is excellent salmon and trout fishing in the{River Teme}which is stocked by the River Authority. In the spring the remaining cherry orchards and the cider orchards are resplendent with blossom. The oldest{Hill Climb}in the country starts in Shelsley Walsh near the{ {X11th century church}, which is well worth a visit. There are race meetings held three times a year at the Hill Climb.
